titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Winterhouse Art and Design Collection of Pentagram Ephemera
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Melissa Quinones

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 23:00

did.unittitle: Winterhouse Art and Design collection of Pentagram ephemera
did.abstract: The collection consists of a variety of pamphlets, booklets, and other ephemera designed by Pentagram.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of William Drenttel and Jessica Helfand, 2013.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Winterhouse Art and Design Collection of Pentagram Ephemera, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a variety of pamphlets, booklets, and other ephemeral publications designed and produced by Pentagram (or Pentagram partners).

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Pentagram is an independent design firm owned and operated by 19 partners. Their offices are located in London, New York, San Francisco, Berlin, and Austin. The firm's projects include architecture, interiors, products, identities, publications, posters, books, exhibitions, websites, and digital installations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Pentagram Papers, 1975-2012. II. Pentagram Projects. III. Pentagram Designers' Catalogues. IV. Pentagram Holiday Greetings, 1977-2008. V. Pentagram and Partners Miscellany, 1986-2000.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically according to the sequential numbering. The set is incomplete.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pentagram Papers is a series privately published by the Pentagram firm since 1975.

did.unittitle: Pentagram Papers 1: ABC A Dictionary of Graphic Cliches

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The folder also includes an article about the Pentagram Papers series by Kathleen Reinmann and published in I.D. Magazine , April 2001.

did.unittitle: Pentagram Papers 12: Olivier Mourgue's Little Theatre of Design
Pentagram Papers 17: The Many Faces of Mao
Pentagram Papers 19: Purple, White and Green
Pentagram Papers 24: The Arms of Paris
Pentagram Papers 26: On Pride and Prejudice on the Arts
Pentagram Papers 26: Nifty Places: The Australian Rural Mailbox
Pentagram Papers 28: Of Money and the Divine
Pentagram Papers 30: Learning from Wildwood, New Jersey
Pentagram Papers 31: Hinagata; Kimono Pattern Books

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains small-format books and ephemera published by the Pentagram firm. The publications reproduce examples of Pentagram design work and are organized by type of project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains ephemera that highlight specific Pentagram designers. Each catalogue reproduces examples of the designer's work and provides brief biographical information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by designer's last name.

did.unittitle: The Product Designs of Kenneth Grange of Pentagram

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Each pamphlet also includes a computer disc with motion graphics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by date of publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains booklets published by the Pentagram firm as holiday greetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Illustrations by Eve Chwast. Printed by Ascensius Press.

did.unittitle: Six Tunes for Eight Wine Bottles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Story by H. L. Chase. Printed by The Stinehour Press.

did.unittitle: "A Guide to the New York City Design Scene"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drawings by Mel Calman. Design by Pentagram.

did.unittitle: "Stripes & Stars: A Graphic History of an American Icon"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Catalog for exhibition hosted at AIGA National Design Center. Design by Pentagram Design.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes contributions by Michael Bierut, Paula Scher, and Woody Pirtle. Portfolio of cards represents silkscreened posters from the International Design Conference in Aspen, June 1995.
